titleStmt.title: Amintor's answer to Parthenia's complaint, or, The wronged shepherds vindication. This answer to the nymph he doth return, since that he hath more cause than she, to mourn and so against alll [sic] women doth complain, for having met with some who were to blame: as by this satire you may find it when he proves that women are more false then men. To a new tune; or Sitting beyond a river side, &c. With allowance.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at the Golden-Ball in Pye-Corner,

notesStmt.note: Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
